trans-unit.source: The BrowserCapabilitiesFactoryBase class is the base class from which <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesFactory"></xref> is derived.

It is used internally at run time by the configuration system to create request-specific instances of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase"></xref> class, publicly accessed through the ASP.NET intrinsic <xref uid="langword_csharp_Request.Browser" name="Request.Browser" href=""></xref> property.
You define browser capabilities in a .browser file.
You can use the default hierarchy in the .browser file or create a custom hierarchy to define the browser capabilities.
Used internally by the configuration system to create a new instance of this class.
Used internally by the configuration system to represent a collection of information relating to various browser capabilities.
A dictionary of browser capabilities.
Used internally at run time to configure an <xref href="System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities"></xref> object.
A collection of request headers.
An <xref href="System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities"></xref> object.
Used internally at run time to configure custom hierarchies of browser capabilities.
You define browser capabilities in a .browser file.
You can use the default hierarchy in the .browser file or create a custom hierarchy to define the browser capabilities.
The ConfigureCustomCapabilities method processes a custom hierarchy.
The custom hierarchy must contain a `parentID` value in the `browser` element.
A collection of request headers.
An object that specifies the capabilities of the browser.

Used internally by the configuration system to determine whether the browser represented by the specified <xref href="System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities"></xref> object does not have an available adapter.
An <xref href="System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities"></xref> object.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the represented browser does not have an available adapter; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Used internally by the configuration system to represent a collection of request-header values.
A collection of request headers.
Used internally by the configuration system to populate a collection of browser capabilities based on the supported browser.
A collection of key/value pairs representing the browser capabilities.
Used internally by the configuration system to populate a collection of request headers based on the supported browser.
A collection of key/value pairs representing the browser capabilities.
